meanings.definition: A person who rides a bicycle with pedals.
meanings.sent1: The group of pedallers rode their bikes through the park.
meanings.sent2: The pedallers in the race were all wearing helmets.
meanings.sent3: The pedallers in the race had a wheelie good time.
meanings.sent4: The pedallers on the road seemed to fly past like colorful birds.
meanings.sent5: The pedallers pedaled with determination, their legs moving in sync.

meanings.definition: A person who operates the pedals of a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The young pedallers played the organ beautifully at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The pedallers in the orchestra synchronized their foot movements.
meanings.sent3: The pedallers at the piano recital had happy feet.
meanings.sent4: The pedallers' feet danced on the organ pedals like magic.
meanings.sent5: The pedallers' skilled footwork on the pedals impressed the audience.

meanings.definition: A person who uses pedals to control a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The truck driver was also a skilled pedaller, smoothly controlling the vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The pedallers in the car race were focused on their footwork.
meanings.sent3: The pedallers in the bus had a foot-tapping journey.
meanings.sent4: The pedallers of the boat navigated the waters with precision.
meanings.sent5: The pedallers of the rickshaw coordinated their movements to move forward.
